column2: AC electrical: what are the two basic principles of operation (select both, recall)?
column3:
• No paralleling of AC power sources.
• A source connected to an AC Transfer Bus automatically disconnects the previous source.
column5: Ch 6 AC Electrical – Basic principles of operation

column2: Does the B737NG utilize a Ram Air Turbine (RAT) as an electrical power source?
column3: No. (Electrical power sources include engine generators (IDG), APU generator, and external power.)

column2: GRD POWER AVAILABLE (blue): what does it indicate?
column3: External power is connected and meets aircraft quality standards (e.g., voltage and frequency).
column5: Ch 6 Controls & Indicators – External power indications

column2: APU GEN OFF BUS (blue): what does it indicate?
column3: APU is running and not powering any AC transfer bus.
column5: Ch 6 Controls & Indicators – APU generator indications

column2: DRIVE (amber): what conditions cause it to illuminate? (best recall)
column3: IDG oil pressure low (below limit) OR an underfrequency condition exists.
column5: Ch 6 Controls & Indicators – IDG/GEN drive indications

column2: GEN OFF BUS (amber): when does it illuminate?
column3: Any time the engine generator is not powering the related AC Transfer Bus (including when the generator is not operating, e.g., engine shutdown).
column5: Ch 6 Controls & Indicators – GEN OFF BUS logic

column2: IDG low oil pressure (DRIVE light illuminated): what are possible causes? (cluster)
column3:
• IDG manually disconnected
• Engine shutdown
• Automatic disconnect
• IDG failure
column5: Ch 6 Controls & Indicators – DRIVE light / IDG disconnect
